required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Omarigliptin (MK-3102) in Obese Participants and in Participants With Type 2 Diabetes (MK-3102-004)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multiple Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of MK3102 in Obese Subjects and in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test the safety and tolerability of omarigliptin. It is hypothesized that administration of once-weekly omarigliptin in obese but otherwise healthy participants, and in obese participants with Type 2 diabetes (T2D) will be sufficiently safe and well tolerated to permit continued clinical investigation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing an Adverse Event (AE)
Number of Participants Withdrawing From Study Therapy Due to an AE

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Inhibition of Dipeptidyl Peptidase-4 (DPP-4) After Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: Percent DPP-4 inhibition at 168 hours after the Day 15 dose (from baseline [pre-dose on Day 1]) was compared in healthy and T2D participants receiving omarigliptin or placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Inhibition of DPP-4 After Day 22
secondary_outcome.description: Percent DPP-4 inhibition at 168 hours after the Day 22 dose (from baseline [pre-dose on Day 1]) was compared in healthy and T2D participants receiving omarigliptin or placebo.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through 4 hours post dose on Day 21
secondary_outcome.description: Weighted average augmentation (WAA) active GLP-1 concentration was based on the 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, and 4 hour timepoints. WAA was calculated as area under the curve (AUC) for the 4-hr post-dose time period (AUC0-4 hrs); this AUC was then divided by the time interval of 4 hours to obtain WAA. Log scale data were then back-transformed to obtain LS means.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through 4 hours post dose on Day 21
secondary_outcome.description: WAA total GLP-1 concentration was based on the 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, and 4 hour timepoints. WAA was calculated as AUC0-4 hrs; this AUC was then divided by the time interval of 4 hours to obtain WAA. Log scale data were then back-transformed to obtain LS means.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through 4 hours post dose on Day 21
secondary_outcome.description: Post-prandial glucose concentration is presented as a weighted average of the 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, and 4 hour post-dose time points. Glucose concentration was calculated as area under the curve (AUC) for the 4-hr post-dose time period (AUC0-4 hrs); this AUC was then divided by the time interval of 4 hours to obtain weighted average glucose concentration. Log scale data were then back-transformed to obtain LS means.

arm_group.description: Obese healthy participants receive once-weekly omarigliptin 50 mg by mouth for 4 weeks (Panel A).
Obese healthy participants receive once-weekly placebo by mouth for 4 weeks (Panel A).
Obese participants with T2D receive once-weekly omarigliptin 50 mg by mouth for 4 weeks (Panel B).
Obese participants with T2D receive once-weekly placebo by mouth for 4 weeks (Panel B).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- obese (body mass index [BMI] ≥30 kg/m² and ≤40 kg/m²) male participants and female participants of non-childbearing potential
- has been diagnosed with T2D (Panel B)
- is not actively participating in a weight loss program
Exclusion Criteria:
- has a history of clinically-significant disease (other than T2D)
- has a history of cancer
- has estimated creatinine clearance ≤60 mL/min
- is unable to refrain from or anticipates the use of any prescription or non-prescription medication
- consumes excessive amounts of alcohol or caffeine
- has participated in a previous omarigliptin study

results_reference.citation: Addy C, Tatosian D, Glasgow XS, Gendrano IN 3rd, Kauh E, Martucci A, Johnson-Levonas AO, Selverian D, Matthews CZ, Gutierrez M, Wagner JA, Aubrey Stoch S. Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Effects of Multiple-dose Administration of Omarigliptin, a Once-weekly Dipeptidyl Peptidase-4 Inhibitor, in Obese Participants With and Without Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus. Clin Ther. 2016 Mar;38(3):516-30. doi: 10.1016/j.clinthera.2015.12.020. Epub 2016 Feb 9.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Participants Experiencing an Adverse Event (AE)
outcome.population: AEs were monitored in all obese healthy (Panel A) and Type 2 diabetes (T2D) (Panel B) participants who received omarigliptin 50 mg or placebo.

measure.title: Number of Participants Withdrawing From Study Therapy Due to an AE
measure.population: AEs were monitored in all obese healthy (Panel A) and T2D (Panel B) participants who received omarigliptin 50 mg or placebo.

outcome.title: Percent Inhibition of Dipeptidyl Peptidase-4 (DPP-4) After Day 15
outcome.description: Percent DPP-4 inhibition at 168 hours after the Day 15 dose (from baseline [pre-dose on Day 1]) was compared in healthy and T2D participants receiving omarigliptin or placebo.
outcome.population: Data from obese healthy participants (Panel A) and obese T2D participants (Panel B) 168 hours post-dose on Day 15 were pooled according to treatment. Predose data from Day 1 were missing from 2 participants.

group.title: Omarigliptin 50 mg
group.description: Obese healthy and T2D participants received once-weekly omarigliptin 50 mg for 4 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Obese healthy and T2D participants received once-weekly placebo for 4 weeks.

measure.title: Percent Inhibition of Dipeptidyl Peptidase-4 (DPP-4) After Day 15
measure.description: Percent DPP-4 inhibition at 168 hours after the Day 15 dose (from baseline [pre-dose on Day 1]) was compared in healthy and T2D participants receiving omarigliptin or placebo.
measure.population: Data from obese healthy participants (Panel A) and obese T2D participants (Panel B) 168 hours post-dose on Day 15 were pooled according to treatment. Predose data from Day 1 were missing from 2 participants.

outcome.title: Percent Inhibition of DPP-4 After Day 22
outcome.description: Percent DPP-4 inhibition at 168 hours after the Day 22 dose (from baseline [pre-dose on Day 1]) was compared in healthy and T2D participants receiving omarigliptin or placebo.
outcome.population: No data from obese healthy participants (Panel A) were collected after pre-dose on Day 22. Therefore, data are presented only for obese T2D participants (Panel B) 168 hours post-dose on Day 22.

group.title: Omarigliptin 50 mg
group.description: Obese healthy and T2D participants received once-weekly omarigliptin 50 mg for 4 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Obese healthy and T2D participants received once-weekly placebo for 4 weeks.

measure.title: Percent Inhibition of DPP-4 After Day 22
measure.description: Percent DPP-4 inhibition at 168 hours after the Day 22 dose (from baseline [pre-dose on Day 1]) was compared in healthy and T2D participants receiving omarigliptin or placebo.
measure.population: No data from obese healthy participants (Panel A) were collected after pre-dose on Day 22. Therefore, data are presented only for obese T2D participants (Panel B) 168 hours post-dose on Day 22.

outcome.title: WAA Active Glucagon-like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) Concentration
outcome.description: Weighted average augmentation (WAA) active GLP-1 concentration was based on the 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, and 4 hour timepoints. WAA was calculated as area under the curve (AUC) for the 4-hr post-dose time period (AUC0-4 hrs); this AUC was then divided by the time interval of 4 hours to obtain WAA. Log scale data were then back-transformed to obtain LS means.
outcome.time_frame: Through 4 hours post dose on Day 21
outcome.population: Data from obese healthy participants (Panel A) and obese T2D participants (Panel B) 4 hours post dose on Day 21 were pooled according to treatment. All participants who received omarigliptin or placebo are included.

group.title: Omarigliptin 50 mg
group.description: Obese healthy and T2D participants received once-weekly omarigliptin 50 mg for 4 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Obese healthy and T2D participants received once-weekly placebo for 4 weeks.

measure.title: WAA Active Glucagon-like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) Concentration
measure.description: Weighted average augmentation (WAA) active GLP-1 concentration was based on the 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, and 4 hour timepoints. WAA was calculated as area under the curve (AUC) for the 4-hr post-dose time period (AUC0-4 hrs); this AUC was then divided by the time interval of 4 hours to obtain WAA. Log scale data were then back-transformed to obtain LS means.
measure.population: Data from obese healthy participants (Panel A) and obese T2D participants (Panel B) 4 hours post dose on Day 21 were pooled according to treatment. All participants who received omarigliptin or placebo are included.

analysis.estimate_desc: GMR is ratio of active GLP-1 levels in omarigliptin:placebo groups.

Glucose concentration was calculated as area under the curve (AUC) for the 4-hr post-dose time period (AUC0-4 hrs); this AUC was then divided by the time interval of 4 hours to obtain weighted average glucose concentration. Log scale data were then back-transformed to obtain LS means.

reported_events.desc: AEs were monitored up to 14 days after the final dose of study drug on Day 22.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The SPONSOR must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the SPONSOR as confidential must be deleted prior to submission. SPONSOR review can be expedited to meet publication timelines.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
